qas.question: Xinhua and CCTV focused on people who what?
Which athlete was ignored by media for supporting the protesters?
Which athlete showed support for the people protesting?
Which publication said that protesters were trampling human rights?

context: <a4_0>Xinhua<a4_0/> and CCTV quoted relay spectators who <a0_0>condemned the protests<a0_0/>, to a greater extent than most Western media, but did not quote any alternate viewpoints, providing no coverage of support for the protests by some ordinary citizens in Western countries. It quoted athletes who expressed pride at taking part in the relays, to a greater extent than Western media, but not those who, like <a1_0><a3_0>Marie-José Pérec<a3_0/><a1_0/>, expressed understanding and support for the protestors. The Beijing Organising Committee for the Games mentioned the "smiling faces of the elderly, children and the artists on the streets", of cheering and supportive Londoners. Xinhua said that protesters were "<a2_0>radicals<a2_0/>" who "trampled human rights" and whose activities were condemned by "the people of the world who cordially love the Olympic spirit".
